name: Jens Lindemann: Tribute to the Trumpet Greats

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
The world-renowned virtuoso pays homage to some of the greatest trumpet players in history including Herb Alpert, Doc Severinsen, Louis Armstrong, Miles Davis, Chuck Mangione, and Chet Baker, accompanied by Robi Botos, Mike Downes, Kristian Alexandrov, and a string ensemble.

Heralded internationally as an outstanding artist, critics from the New York Times and Los Angeles Times have stated: "He played with golden timbre and virtuosic flair" and he is "a world-class talent".

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music!

name: 21C Afterhours: GGS New Music Ensemble

location.name: Temerty Theatre, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Curated and conducted by Brian Current, this striking program features the world premiere of Ways of Becoming by Christina Volpini, composed for Violin Soloist Joelle Crigger and chamber orchestra, as commissioned by the Glenn Gould School of Music. 

Edgard Var√®se's Offrandes (1921) for soprano, ensemble, and six percussionists, performed by Daniele Carreon Herrera, is a groundbreaking work that marked a turning point in 20th century music. The evening culminates in Clara Iannotta's a stir among the stars, a making way, a work of otherworldly beauty that continues to captivate audiences at the world's most prestigious contemporary music festivals.

name: Interior Design Show Toronto 2026

location.name: Metro Toronto Convention Centre: North Building

description:
Canada's leading design fair returns with a bold vision for the future of design, renewed sense of purpose and a sharp focus on the ideas reshaping the global design landscape. 

This year's edition explores a pivotal moment in the industry, defined by breakthroughs in material innovation, lighting technology, AI-driven design tools, and new forms of international collaboration.

Attend as world-leading designers, emerging studios, future-focused brands, and thousands of industry professionals and design enthusiasts for four days of exhibitions, talks, installations, and product debuts.

name: #BeyondTO 2026
description:
Returning in 2026 we are proud to present our fourth iteration of this series, connecting Toronto with critically acclaimed International works that push the boundaries of live performance and cultural storytelling.

This year features BeyondTO returning artists, Wayqeycuna by Tiziano Cruz (Argentina) and Mark of a Woman by Chisato Minamimura (United Kingdom). These are two visionary artists whose work explores the intersections of identity, heritage, memory, and the human body. 

In Wayqeycuna, Tiziano Cruz draws from archival research and personal history and reflects on how racial hierarchies and systems of domination persist in a world reshaped by neoliberalism's erasure of cultural and collective identities.

In Mark of a Woman, the personal histories and tattooing culture is explored and celebrated.

Audiences to experience the world through radically different perspectives, each one redefining how we connect across cultures, languages, and lived experience.

name: Orchestra Toronto: Darth Vader Meets The Godfather

location.name: George Weston Recital Hall, Meridian Arts Centre

description:
Presenting our first-ever concert dedicated entirely to film music, an exciting addition to our season! 

This cinematic program highlights two landmark scores that transformed the role of orchestral music in film. 

Nino Rota's music for The Godfather draws on Sicilian folk traditions and classical forms to deepen the film's exploration of family, legacy, and moral ambiguity. John Williams's Star Wars score channels the grandeur of late-Romantic composers like Wagner and Holst, using recurring musical themes to represent characters, places, and ideas across the saga. 

Together, these works reveal how orchestral soundtracks have shaped the emotional and narrative landscape of modern cinema.

name: Anne Walker: CD Release Concert
description:
A cherished voice in Canadian folk, Anne Walker returns to Acoustic Harvest for the launch of her newest album. Known for her poetic lyrics, rich vocals, and emotional depth, Anne's songs weave personal stories with universal themes, resonating long after the final note.

This intimate evening will feature new material alongside beloved favourites, performed with warmth, grace, and a touch of humour.
